page.title: 08The Farming Calendar
page.content: LAMBING STARTS ABOUT MID MARCH. FEW CALVES ARE BORN THEN AS MOST ARE BORN DURING THE AUTUMN. AFTER LAMBING IS COMPLETED THE SPRING CORN IS SOWN. THE SHEEP ARE PUT OUT ON TO THE HILLS AT THE END OF MAY, BUT IN LATE JUNE OR EARLY JULY THEY ARE AGAIN GATHERED IN TO BE SHORN AND DIPPED,AND THEIR LAMBS ARE DRENCHED, BEFORE BEING ONCE AGAIN RETURNED TO THE HILLS. THIS IS FOLLOWED BY HAYMAKING AND SILAGING. DURING SEPTEMBER COMBINING TAKES PLACE AFTER WHICH THE FIELDS ARE READY FOR THE AUTUMN CORN. AT AUTUMN TIME THE LAMBS ARE FATTENED AND SOLD. DURING DECEMBER THE SHEEP ARE ONCE AGAIN BROUGHT DOWN TO LOWER PASTURES WHERE THEY ARE FED UNTIL MAY
